body:
### Describe the bug

The coverage build of python-flint fails with current Cython master since commit ed2b40be6cad736ab39cffa2503d816ef2c6741e from gh-6144.

It always at the same point in the test suite with the same exception about thread.lock:
```console
$ PYTHONPATH=src coverage run -m flint.test
Running tests...
test_pyflint...OK
...
test_polys...OK
test_mpolys...OK
test_fmpz_mpoly_vec...Exception ignored in: <_cython_3_1_0a0_mon.generator object at 0x71d86d8f03b0>
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "src/flint/types/fmpz_mpoly.pyx", line 1274, in __iter__
    yield z
  File "/stuff/current/active/python-flint/.venv313/lib/python3.13/site-packages/coverage/collector.py", line 252, in lock_data
    self.data_lock.acquire()
SystemError: <method 'acquire' of '_thread.lock' objects> returned a result with an exception set
```
At this point the process hangs, possibly in a deadlock or something. I can interrupt with Ctrl-C a few times which reveals a bit more traceback:

```console
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^

```

The specific line of Cython code at which this happens is:
https://github.com/flintlib/python-flint/blob/292fa0d51e2a59c15fd757e15fd5687526496dad/src/flint/types/fmpz_mpoly.pyx#L1274

There are not many places in the codebase that actually use `yield` in the Cython code i.e. not many generator functions so this is possibly just the first occurrence of a generator function in the test suite.

The problem only arises when:

- Using Python 3.13 (earlier versions are fine)
- Building with Cython after commit ed2b40be6cad736ab39cffa2503d816ef2c6741e
- Using a coverage enabled build of the Cython modules (`CYTHON_TRACE=1`, `linetrace=True`).
- Running the tests under `coverage`.

This works fine:
```
python -m flint.test
```
However this fails with `SystemError` at the `yield` as shown above:
```
coverage run -m flint.test
```
Running under `coverage` works fine though if not using the `CYTHON_TRACE` and `linetrace` options i.e. when not using a coverage enabled build.

I see that there is https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy/issues/1790 which says that coverage will disable Cython's coverage plugin. Note though that I see this failure when running under coverage even if not actually using any coverage plugin.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

I have not distilled this to a simple reproducer but I imagine that something involving generator functions will do it.

### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Linux and I think I also saw it on MacOS as well previously

### Python version

3.13 (earlier versions are fine)

### Cython version

`3.1.0a1+` (versions `<=3.0.11` are fine).

### Additional context

_No response_
